Text.Value: You think yourself capable of it? Come then, let us put your ambition to the test.

EditorData.NodeContext: ice cold, Gale has threatened her, she's about to demonstrate the extent of her own powers in response.

Text.Value: This offering cost you greatly. There is no hope in life as an illithid, devoid of soul and conscience.

EditorData.NodeContext: respectful - Gale sacrificed his humanity to achieve what she asked.

Text.Value: So, Gale of Waterdeep, you have become the inheritor of Karsus' powers at last.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Fade up on the majesty of the outer planes. All is quiet, still, tranquil, then - something begins to happen. A new constellation begins to form in the shape of Gale's tattoo, tendrils of Netherese magic flickering around him like flashes of lightning. Pure, unbirdled power. 

A second symbol forms, of a similar size to Gale's. This one in the shape of Mystra's sigil, its magic the purer white/blue of the Weave. Then, we see Gale - in god-human or god-illithid form. He stands on the rippling firmament of the outer planes, Mystra before him.
EditorData.NodeContext: Neutral, not giving anything away yet. Gale now has the complete Crown of Karsus in his possession, and has gained the equivalent power of a minor god.

Text.Value: Know this - the Weave will never answer to you. Set your 'ambition' to that purpose, and you will feel the wrath of a true god. One worthy of the name.

EditorData.NodeContext: ice cold, Gale has threatened her, she's about to demonstrate the extent of her own powers in response.

Text.Value: Tell me. What do you intend to do with them?

EditorData.NodeContext: Neutral, not giving anything away yet. Gale now has the complete Crown of Karsus in his possession, and has gained the equivalent power of a minor god.

Text.Value: Being an illithid has its advantages. I'm content as I am.
Being an illithid has its advantages. I'm content as I am.
Go, Gale of Waterdeep. Your life is your own at last. It's time you went and lived it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere, well-meant. Potentially the last big line of the game so should feel epic/final

Text.Value: Then you are free to go with both my thanks and my promise - henceforth, your prayers will always be answered.
Perhaps one day, but for now there is more I need to accomplish.
Perhaps one day, but for now there is more I need to accomplish.
Spoken like the wizard you were meant to be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere, approving - this is a hard-won compliment for the player.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Her piece said, Mystra disappears. The tattoo on Gale's chest begins to glow, his powers coming fully into being. He smiles to himself - godhood is his. In the Astral expanse above him, his symbol appears, glowing with power.  The God of Ambition has arrived.

Text.Value: You already love another, Gale. I see them, waiting for you. It is to them you must return.

EditorData.NodeContext: Doing what's best for him - returning him to his partner. Sincerely meant, no hard feelings.

Text.Value: I want to be your Chosen once more. And this time, I won't let you down.
So be it. Gale of Waterdeep, Chosen of Mystra.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere emotion - welcoming Gale back to his rightful place, the culmination of all his efforts. Should feel epic for the player - the last big line of their story, really - to have re-earned a place alongside their goddess.

Text.Value: Thank you, but no. I have someone waiting for me.
Thank you, but no. I have someone waiting for me.
Ambition. A fitting domain, for that is the only thing you will have to offer your worshippers.

EditorData.NodeContext: ice cold,dripping with scorn. Gale has proven the arrogant, hubristic fool she feared he was.

Text.Value: I will become a new kind of god. One with ambition.
I will become a new kind of god. One with ambition.
I came to surrender them. The Crown, the Karsite Weave - take it all.
I came to surrender them. The Crown, the Karsite Weave - take it all.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Human Mystra and Human/Illithid Gale adopt tense/prepared poses, confrontation brewing between them (not leading to actual combat on-screen). In the skies, both Mystra and Gale's symbols grow in intensity, becoming stormlike. Flashes of light, the rumble and crackle of magic building dangerously. Their clouds grow and exactly as they make contact with hear an almighty CRACKLE (magical storms making contact), then cut to black and hear-

Text.Value: Patience, Gale. All in good time...

EditorData.NodeContext: Neither a no nor a yes, but with a hint of hope that it might be possible.

Text.Value: I only wanted to make things right. We need never see each other again.
I want you back, Mystra. I want us to be lovers again.
I crave nothing more. Take me to Elysium.
I crave nothing more. Take me to Elysium.
I'm here for your godhood, Mystra. I'm going to rule the Weave.
I'm here for your godhood, Mystra. I'm going to rule the Weave.
You should have remained mortal, Gale of Waterdeep. You would have lived longer.

EditorData.NodeContext: Heavy with promise of conflict to come - potentially the last line of the main story so should send a chill up the spine

Text.Value: You do a great service here. Not only for your goddess, but for magic itself. It will never be forgotten. Nor will I forget you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere acknowledgement of what Gale has done. A touch more personal at the end - letting the aloof persona slip, a glimpse of the closer bond Gale once shared with her

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Mystra gestures, and the comet on Gale's chest begins to glow, the magic of Karsus being drawn from his chest at last. He nods his thanks at mystra, who smiles and disappers. Then, Gale closes his eyes, contentment on his face, and lets her spell do its work. As the magic is drawn forth, Gale's symbol in the sky begins to fade/flicker. Then - with a brilliant FLASH it is gone. The outer planes are at peace once again, as is Gale.

Text.Value: It is within my power to restore your soul, and your humanity, if you are willing to leave the mortal realms behind. Return with me, to Elysium.

EditorData.NodeContext: respectful - Gale sacrificed his humanity to achieve what she asked. If he's willing to die on the mortal planes, she will restore his soul and body to him but in the heavens.
